header: ORDER BELOW EXH.1 IN CRIMINAL BAIL APPLICATION No. 109/2019 (Pradip Ramchandra Mane and 9 Ors. Vs. State of Maharashtra) CNR : MHST01­000560­2019

background.text: 1) Present bail application is preferred by the applicants under section 439 of Criminal Procedure Code, 1973 seeking their release from having being arrested under execution of non bailable warrant issued by Ld. J.M.F.C. Khandala in R.C.C. no. 46/2015.

legalActFound.stringMatched: under section 439 of criminal procedure code

arguments.text: 2) It is contended by applicant's advocate that, accused are arrested under execution of NBW at the time the accused's preferred application for cancellation of the said warrants. It is contended that, the present accused out of inadvertence and miscommunication with their advocate, did not have proper knowledge of the date of hearing and remained absent. It is contended that, all the accused undertake to attend every date of hearing henceforth and to coperate in expediting the trial. Accordingly, bail is contended.

argumentSentences.text: 2) It is contended by applicant's advocate that, accused are arrested under execution of NBW at the time the accused's preferred application for cancellation of the said warrants.
It is contended that, the present accused out of inadvertence and miscommunication with their advocate, did not have proper knowledge of the date of hearing and remained absent.
It is contended that, all the accused undertake to attend every date of hearing henceforth and to coperate in expediting the trial.

arguments.text: 3) Bail application is resisted by the APP by filing say at Exh. 4 on the grounds that, accused are arrested in breach of conditions as per section 436(2) of Criminal Procedure Code, 1973, hence are not entitled for bail. It is contended that, in case of released on bail, they may abscond and protract the trial. Accordingly, bail is resisted.

argumentSentences.text: 3) Bail application is resisted by the APP by filing say at Exh. 4 on the grounds that, accused are arrested in breach of conditions as per section 436(2) of Criminal Procedure Code, 1973, hence are not entitled for bail.
It is contended that, in case of released on bail, they may abscond and protract the trial.

arguments.text: 4) Upon hearing the APP and applicant's advocate and perusing the papers, it appears that, applicants/accused are arrested under execution of NBW issued by the Ld. JMFC Khandala. Perusal of the record reveals that, there are other persons are also arrayed as accused in the matter. Thus, it cannot be said that, the trial was protected only due to absence of these accused. In such circumstances, keeping the accused arrested pending the trial, would amount to punishment before trial, which is not justifiable. At the same time, APP's apprehensions shall also have to be considered for ensuring accused's presence at the hearing and facing trial. The same can be secured by subjecting the accused to certain conditions. Hence, the following order.

argumentSentences.text: 4) Upon hearing the APP and applicant's advocate and perusing the papers, it appears that, applicants/accused are arrested under execution of NBW issued by the Ld. JMFC Khandala.
Perusal of the record reveals that, there are other persons are also arrayed as accused in the matter.
Thus, it cannot be said that, the trial was protected only due to absence of these accused.
In such circumstances, keeping the accused arrested pending the trial, would amount to punishment before trial, which is not justifiable.
At the same time, APP's apprehensions shall also have to be considered for ensuring accused's presence at the hearing and facing trial.
The same can be secured by subjecting the accused to certain conditions.

order.text: O R D E R 1) Criminal Bail Application no. 109/2019, is allowed; 2) Applicant no. 1 Pradip Ramchandra Mane, no. 2 Manoj Jagadevarao Deshmukh, no. 3 Rahul Krishna Kamble, no. 4 Rahul @ Mahesh Prakash Khalekar, no. 5 Sampat Pandurang Magar, no. 6 Sagar Shivaji Khalekar, no. 7 Krishna Prakash Shinde, no. 8 Abhijit Kashinath Khade, no. 9 Sanjay Shankararao Deshmukh and no. 10 Rahul Prabhakar Hadke, be released on bail from their arrest under execution of NBW issued in R.C.C. no. 46/2015 upon paying penalty of Rs. 2,000/­ each (Rs.Two Thousand Hundred each); and executing personal bond of Rs.25,000/­ each (Rs. Twenty Five Thousand) with atleast one or more local surety/ies, to make up the bail amount; on following terms & conditions; a) Applicants shall not tamper with evidence. b) Applicants shall not directly or indirectly make any inducement, threat or promise to any person acquainted with the facts of the case so as to dissuade him from disclosing such facts to the court or to any Police Officer. c) Applicants shall attend each and every date of hearing, failing which the bail granted herein shall automatically stand cancelled. d) Applicants shall provide their addresses of availability and operative mobile numbers to concern police station. Accused shall always be available through their given mobile numbers. e) Compliance before lower Court.

footer: (Y. H. Ameta) Place : Satara Addl. Sessions Judge Date :­ 15th February, 2019. Satara
processedText:
ORDER BELOW EXH.1 IN CRIMINAL BAIL APPLICATION No. 109/2019 (Pradip Ramchandra Mane and 9 Ors. Vs. State of Maharashtra) CNR : MHST01­000560­2019 
---header-ends---
1) Present bail application is preferred by the applicants under section 439 of Criminal Procedure Code, 1973 seeking their release from having being arrested under execution of non bailable warrant issued by Ld. J.M.F.C. Khandala in R.C.C. no. 46/2015. 
---background-ends---
2) It is contended by applicant's advocate that, accused are arrested under execution of NBW at the time the accused's preferred application for cancellation of the said warrants. It is contended that, the present accused out of inadvertence and miscommunication with their advocate, did not have proper knowledge of the date of hearing and remained absent. It is contended that, all the accused undertake to attend every date of hearing henceforth and to coperate in expediting the trial. Accordingly, bail is contended. 
---argument-ends---
3) Bail application is resisted by the APP by filing say at Exh. 4 on the grounds that, accused are arrested in breach of conditions as per section 436(2) of Criminal Procedure Code, 1973, hence are not entitled for bail. It is contended that, in case of released on bail, they may abscond and protract the trial. Accordingly, bail is resisted. 
---argument-ends---
4) Upon hearing the APP and applicant's advocate and perusing the papers, it appears that, applicants/accused are arrested under execution of NBW issued by the Ld. JMFC Khandala. Perusal of the record reveals that, there are other persons are also arrayed as accused in the matter. Thus, it cannot be said that, the trial was protected only due to absence of these accused. In such circumstances, keeping the accused arrested pending the trial, would amount to punishment before trial, which is not justifiable. At the same time, APP's apprehensions shall also have to be considered for ensuring accused's presence at the hearing and facing trial. The same can be secured by subjecting the accused to certain conditions. Hence, the following order. 
---argument-ends---
O R D E R 1) Criminal Bail Application no. 109/2019, is allowed; 2) Applicant no. 1 Pradip Ramchandra Mane, no. 2 Manoj Jagadevarao Deshmukh, no. 3 Rahul Krishna Kamble, no. 4 Rahul @ Mahesh Prakash Khalekar, no. 5 Sampat Pandurang Magar, no. 6 Sagar Shivaji Khalekar, no. 7 Krishna Prakash Shinde, no. 8 Abhijit Kashinath Khade, no. 9 Sanjay Shankararao Deshmukh and no. 10 Rahul Prabhakar Hadke, be released on bail from their arrest under execution of NBW issued in R.C.C. no. 46/2015 upon paying penalty of Rs. 2,000/­ each (Rs.Two Thousand Hundred each); and executing personal bond of Rs.25,000/­ each (Rs. Twenty Five Thousand) with atleast one or more local surety/ies, to make up the bail amount; on following terms & conditions; a) Applicants shall not tamper with evidence. b) Applicants shall not directly or indirectly make any inducement, threat or promise to any person acquainted with the facts of the case so as to dissuade him from disclosing such facts to the court or to any Police Officer. c) Applicants shall attend each and every date of hearing, failing which the bail granted herein shall automatically stand cancelled. d) Applicants shall provide their addresses of availability and operative mobile numbers to concern police station. Accused shall always be available through their given mobile numbers. e) Compliance before lower Court. 
---order-ends---
(Y. H. Ameta) Place : Satara Addl. Sessions Judge Date :­ 15th February, 2019. Satara
